column4: Rubin and nalioth: hm, it still wants to upgrade. the old package is called beep-media-player-0.9.7.1+cvs... and the new one is beep-media-player-0.9.7.1-1, so I wrote Pin: version 0.9.7.1-1*, any ideas?
do you use synaptic?
right now I am using console: aptitude update and aptitude upgrade
it's easy in synaptic, i'm having pinning troubles myself atm
there is a bug that may affect YOU if you have a preferences file
yes, I put it in the /etc/apt/preferences... Ok, I try to do it in synaptic instead...
save your preferences file and see if you can update and upgrade
let us know waht happens
hm, but that is what I had, a preferences file with two lines: "Package: beep-media-player" an "Pin: version 0.9.7.1-1*" (OK, I am a bit confused)
that sounds correct. save it and see if you can update and upgrade
hm, when I opened synaptic it complained about no priority for the pin,so maybe I should add that (even though it says somewhere it is not needed)
thought you used aptitude.
we need to stick to a front end for this bug check, please, and the front end should be aptitude or apt-get
ah, adding a Pin-Priority in /etc/apt/preferences did it! :)
please save it and update and upgrade
so now it works with aptitude, when Pin-Priority is set
upgrading works fine? no weird error msgs?
yes, both update and upgrade runs without problems (and upgrade without wanting to "upgrade" to the older cvs package)
good to hear! i've got a bug associated with my pinning, and i can't figure it out
share the love, help someone else
yes, I should (I am usually helping people in #math and #latex, with linux I am not so good myself, but maybe one can help someone) :)
